result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor T Lucero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 22 days credit if revoked.  Straight-time.

Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County.  Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 2 years, if all conditions are met and Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost/Surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.  ($582.24 to be held)  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances  or drug paraphernalia.   No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.    Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by VA.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  

NO VIOLENT contact with Victim A or any other family member.

Anger Management and/or DV counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

No use or possession of weapons. (e.g. knives, firearms etc.)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

To be determined at future date.
08/05/2022 PER REQUEST, COURT SETS RESTITUTION TO ZERO. REMAINING BOND REFUNDED TO POSTER.

Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County.  Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 2 years, if all conditions are met and Agent deems appropriate.

See Count 3 for Additional Conditions.

Order Vacating Protective Order signed by Judge Dorow
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

EFFECTIVE 5/05/2022. 
CONDITIONS MODIFIED: 

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key except as noted below.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent, EXCEPT for weekly visits with the children, marriage counseling with Victim A, and transportation of Victim A to and from her treatment sessions.  Defendant is further authorized to be with his children at a park or other public place while his wife is a her treatment appointments. Defendant is required for this condition to be approved by his case manager. Case Manager to work with WCS. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant may NOT spend any overnights at the home of Victim A. If the Defendant is discharged prior to successful completion, and upon being notified of the same, contact shall revert to NO CONTACT -NO EXCEPTIONS. The Defendant is allowed daily electronic contact with Victim A/B/C/D. Parties are not to discuss the case in any way. 

IF DEFENDANT IS NOT RESIDING AT A TREATMENT FACILITY, DEFENDANT TO RESIDE AT VA HOUSING FACILITY. DEFENDANT shall maintain absolute sobriety; defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

Case called as a tagalong to 22CF421.
Victim A filed a request to be heard by the court modifying the bond.
State objects to modification of bond for reasons as stated on the record.
Defense is in favor of modification of no contact provision of bond. 
Victim A is sworn in and questioned by the court. 
State and Defense have no questions.
Victim A steps down.
Court vacates the Protective Order in this case.
Defense to file treatment schedule with the court. 
Court modifies conditions of bond as placed on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

to the Court filed by Atty. Chris Hartley regarding bonds and transportation to the VA hospital.    **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 3/15/22. I need this case to come in tomorrow morning at either 815 or 830 so that I can address this. I know what my intention was in modifying the bond and it was to allow for the reduction from cash to a signature bond in the new case so that he could be released. I needed to adjust what I did in the other case becau because I frankly wanted the same condition that he go to treatment in both. I did not otherwise intend to change anything about the bond in the other case. * Notified parties by email. TB
Hearing on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:41 AM Defendant Victor T Lucero in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Public Defender, Jeffrey Jensen, appears as a friend to the Court.
Victim/Witness also appears by zoom. Victim appears in person. 
Case called for Bail/Bond Hearing.
State advises a bed will be available at the VA for a treatment program on 3/16/22. 
State makes recommendations about bail and conditions requesting cash bond be converted to signature bond on 3/16/22.
Defense advises the court of arrangements made to get Defendant into treatment.
Victim A.D. makes statement to the court and requests No Contact Order be removed once Defendant is in treatment. 
Parties do not object to telephone or text contact between Victim A and the Defendant for the sole purposes of discussing topics related to their children. No criminal cases are to be discussed. 
The condition would not take effect until the injunction is altered. 
Effective 3/16/22, the Court will convert the cash bond of $25,000 to a signature bond of $25,000 with conditions. 
Hearing 4/20/22 is cancelled to allow Defendant to complete treatment.

08:38 AM Defendant Victor T Lucero in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sydney Starr, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State has complied with victim's rights.
The victim appeared. 
Case is set for bail/bond hearing. 
This is the first appearance in front of Branch 2.
The parties are asking the court to reduce the bond. 
The victim does not object. 
The Court will reduce the cash bond to $5,000 and add a condition.
The Court will add a signature bond that is to be co-signed by Daniel Nelson.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Victor T Lucero in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Hartley states the parties have stipulated to a reduction of cash bail to allow for the defendant to report to the VA and receive inpatient treatment as soon as a bed is available.  The State confirms that is the agreement of the parties so long as an additional condition of bail is that the defendant will report to the VA to seek inpatient treatment.  The Court is inclined to get a quick date before the Trial Court to address bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Christopher Hartley.
Atty. Chris Hartley.
